doc.field: Ara Pacis Augustae. The Ara Pacis was first dedicated in 9 B.C. to celebrate Augustus' victories over Spain and Gaul. It was reconstructed in the 1930s and is now housed in a modern building which also has a temporary exhibition space. According to the guy who did the "Ancient Worlds" series on the BBC, by showing women and children Augustus was trying to spin his imperial role as a man of all the people type.
italy rome roma italia peace altar day3 ara augustus arapacis pacis rome2010

Ara Pacis Augustae. The Ara Pacis was first dedicated in 9 B.C. to celebrate Augustus' victories over Spain and Gaul. It was reconstructed in the 1930s and is now housed in a modern building which also has a temporary exhibition space. This is a model of the real thing that stands alongside the real thing.
